meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characterized by an anastomosis.
meanings.sent1: The analectic network of blood vessels allowed for efficient circulation.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon described the analectic connection between the arteries.
meanings.sent3: The analectic pathways in the garden made it easy for visitors to explore.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed through her mind like an analectic river, connecting ideas seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The analectic design of the puzzle ensured all pieces fit together perfectly.

meanings.definition: A collection of writings or speeches.
meanings.sent1: The library contained an analectic of ancient scrolls and manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading the analectic of poems by different authors.
meanings.sent3: The professor's analectic of research papers was so vast it filled multiple bookshelves.
meanings.sent4: His mind was an analectic of memories, each one a different story to tell.
meanings.sent5: The anthology was an analectic of diverse voices and perspectives.
